item.title: Co-Creation: I’m ready to contribute now… Stage 7 of 7
item.description:
Co-Creation: I’m ready to contribute now… Stage 7 of 7

Co-Creating with God Because we are made in God’s image, we have the built in desire to help create God’s vision by doing what we can to make the world a better place.

item.title: Integration: How is life different? The same? Who am I now? Stage 6 of 7
item.description:
Integration: How is life different? The same? Who am I now? Stage 6 of 7

Does TBI Make Me a New Person? I have read that TBI causes us to become a new person. That is quite a stark statement. It startled me into realizing that I should not expect to be able to do what I used to. I have let go of my expectation, though not my desire, to be present in the same way I used to, to do the same things I used to, live life the same way I used to.

item.title: Acceptance: Wow. This really is part of my life. Stage 5 of 7.
item.description:
Acceptance: Wow. This really is part of my life. Stage 5 of 7.

God with usAcceptance comes when we finally stop trying to change reality and we know that God is with us. The more we can experience God being with us, especially during the harder times, the easier it is for us to accept what we are going through.Grace

item.title: Depression: I don’t care anymore. Stage 4 of 7.
item.description:
Depression: I don’t care anymore. Stage 4 of 7.

undefined

item.title: Bargaining: What if? Stage 3 of 7
item.description:
Bargaining: What if? Stage 3 of 7

If I blame the person who ran the red light, or somehow caused the accident I am likely to be angry at them, curse them, but I ultimately realize that they do not have the ability to change what happened.

item.title: Anger: WHY is THIS happening to ME? Stage 2 of 7
item.description:
Anger: WHY is THIS happening to ME? Stage 2 of 7

Angry at … God?

item.title: Denial: This is NOT happening to me! Stage 1 of 7
item.description:
Denial: This is NOT happening to me! Stage 1 of 7

In its simplest form, denial finds us trying to convince ourselves that “this is not happening!” However, there are some very sly ways we can do this — all of which are futile attempts at controlling reality. One example comes from my own experience.
